The risk of transmission is possible at the end of pregnancy and may result in neonatal congenital measles, but this is exceptional (given vaccination coverage).

properties.question: What is the likelihood of neonatal congenital measles transmission at the end of pregnancy given high vaccination coverage?
properties.option_a: Highly likely, as measles is highly contagious regardless of vaccination status.
properties.option_b: Moderately likely, since some infants may not have been fully vaccinated.
properties.option_c: Exceptionally rare, due to the effectiveness of vaccination programs.
properties.option_d: Always present, as measles can be transmitted through airborne particles.
